description: From Ancient Greek βραχύς (brakhús, “short”); compare brachy-.

entries.meaning: (botany) Unusually small size resulting from the shortening of internodes.
examples: In teosinte there is no such indication of brachysm, all branches having elongated internodes. The first indication of the contamination of teosinte with maize is in the direction of brachysm, as instanced by a shortening of the pistillate rachis, resulting in displacing the alignment of the seeds and a shortening also of the lateral vegetative branches.
